cab.content: From Viceroy, Army Department, 18th May 1917.(Received at India Office, 10.30 a.m. 19th.)7313. On 16th May a column, one and a half battalions and two guns from Nili Kach found the Gwaleri Pass held in force by Mahsuds and withheld (withdrew?) to Nili Kach with the following casualties: One Gurkha officer and 16 rank killed, nine wounded and four missing; Second Lieutenant Downie, l/4th Gurkhas, wounded. 43rd Infantry Brigade has completed concentration at Tank.
